title: Vitis chungii
text: Vitis chungii is a <a href="polygamo-dioecious">polygamo-dioecious</a> species of wild <a href="grape">grape</a> native to <a href="China">China</a> (in <a href="Fujian">Fujian</a>, <a href="Guangdong">Guangdong</a>, <a href="Guangxi">Guangxi</a>, and <a href="Jiangxi">Jiangxi</a> provinces) where it is known by the name min gan pu tao, or Fujian Jianxi grape. It is a <a href="forest">forest</a> inhabitant, 200–1000 meters above sea-level, on hillsides, in valleys, or other areas having wild, <a href="shrub">shrub</a>by growth. It bears globular, ruddy-purple <a href="Berry%20%28botany%29">berries</a>, 8–10 mm in diameter.
